explanation: MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static — the target calls this first; need its prototype/definition to see whether it can fail in a way that changes control flow (e.g. non-returning behavior, longjmp/exit, or attributes that affect reachability). MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls — static implementation delegate shown in the call graph; its body may contain non-returning constructs or attributes that make the caller’s subsequent statements unreachable. MHD_queue_response — the function whose return is used and which might itself be non-returning (noreturn attribute), perform longjmp/exit, or otherwise change control flow; its declaration/definition is needed to determine if the call makes later statements unreachable. MHD_destroy_response — called after queueing; its definition may contain non-returning behavior or compiler builtins that affect reachability (per call graph it calls __builtin_unreachable). __builtin_unreachable — appears in the callees’ call graph; its use in callee implementations or macros can indicate intentionally unreachable code paths or influence compiler analysis of reachability. enum MHD_Result — the return type of the function; its definition helps determine whether any return paths are constrained or mapped to special values that relate to control-flow conventions in this codebase. MHD_HTTP_BAD_REQUEST — the status code passed to MHD_queue_response; include to inspect any macros or wrappers that could expand to control-flow affecting constructs. BAD_REQUEST_PAGE — the buffer argument used to create the response; include to check whether it is a macro or expression that might contain control-flow (e.g. function calls, macros that expand to statements) rather than a plain string literal.
